oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Nanostructured metal-insulator-metal capacitor with anodic titania
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: KANNADASSAN, D
KARTHIK, R
BAGHINI, MS
MALLICK, PS
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Anodization
Dielectric polarization
Frequency dependent capacitance
Leakage mechanisms
Crystalline properties
MIM CAPACITORS
HIGH-DENSITY
OXIDE-FILMS
THIN-FILMS
PERFORMANCE
OXIDATION
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This paper presents fabrication and electrical characterization of barrier type TiO2 metal-insulator-metal (MIM) capacitor using anodization. Polarization process, conduction mechanisms, and structural properties are studied in detail. We found that the anodization voltage played a major role in electrical and structural properties of the thin film. The barrier type anodic TiO2 is suggested as a dielectric material for high-performance MIM capacitors. (c) 2012 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.
